title: Rugby World Cup 2019 – Ireland vs Russia live!
text:
Follow live updates from the Rugby World Cup as Ireland bid to get their campaign back on track against Russia.

The Irish were humbled by hosts Japan last week, losing 19-12 in an absorbing thriller in Shizuoka.

Head coach Joe Schmidt has rung the changes for today’s clash, making 11 in total, with Johnny Sexton set to captain from 10. They take on a Russia team that has yet to pick up a point, having lost against Japan and Samoa so far. Follow the live action below:

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Teams Ireland: Kearney; Conway, Ringrose, Aki, Earls; Sexton (capt), McGrath; Kilcoyne, Scannell, Ryan, Kleyn, Beirne, Ruddock, O’Mahony, Murphy

Russia: Artemyev; Davydov, Galinovskiy, Golosnitskiy, Simplikevich; Gaisin, Perov; Polivalov, Matveev, Gotovtsev, Garbuzov, Fedotko; Sychev, Gadzhiev, Gresev

We'll get going in an hour or so. In the meantime, here's my preview for this morning's clash! Russian ‘scare’ last thing Joe Schmidt needs for his wounded Ireland Hello all and welcome to The Independent's live coverage of this morning's Rugby World Cup clash between Ireland and Russia.



I'll be bringing you all the live action, reaction and analysis from Kobe - so make sure to stay tuned!

What time is it?

Ireland vs Russia kicks off at 7.15pm Japan Standard Time, which is 11.15am BST, on Thursday 3 October.

Where can I watch it?

ITV1 will be broadcasting the clash. Alternatively, you can live stream the match on your laptop, smartphone or tablet via the ITV Hub.
description: Follow live updates from the Rugby World Cup as Ireland bid to get their campaign back on track against Russia. The Irish were humbled by hosts Japan last week, losing 19-12 in an absorbing thriller in Shizuoka.
